title: Generate Bar Plots Easily in R
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(generate.barplot) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Create a bar plot — generate_barplot
text: Create bar plots visualize distribution categorical variable data frame. ensures input dataset valid selected column factor plotting.

title: Create a bar plot — generate_barplot
text: dataset data frame containing categorical variable. x name column visualized (string). x_name user-friendly label x-axis.

title: Create a bar plot — generate_barplot
code: # example code barplot <- generate_barplot(dataset = mtcars, x = "gear", x_name = "Gear")  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ barplot <- generate_barplot(dataset = mtcars, x = "gear", x_name = gear)  } # }
